item.title: CS140-lecture-20211006
item.description: Common divide and conquer problems # Counting Inversions # Inversions are the number of out of order pairs in an array of numbers. We can use the amount of inversions as a ranking for multiple arrays. If we consider the first array as sorted (the indices), we can use the second array’s indices as a rank to compare. When we try and count inversions, we are given an array of \( n \) numbers.
